snippet: The move to stall Chuck Hagel’s nomination for defense secretary was likely to worsen partisan tensions while keeping the White House from assembling its national security team.
abstract: Senate Republicans block nomination of Chuck Hagel, Pres Obama's choice to lead the Pentagon, in a defiant move likely to worsen partisan tensions; move, at least temporarily, keeps the White House from assembling its national security team; Democrats vow to try again to resuscitate the nomination when Senate returns from recess.

byline.contributor: Jim Rutenberg and Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The move to stall Chuck Hagel’s nomination for defense secretary was likely to worsen partisan tensions while keeping the White House from assembling its national security team.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Senators Block Vote on Defense Post for Hagel
headline.main: G.O.P. Blocks Vote in Senate on Hagel for Defense Post
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Blocks Vote on Hagel In the Senate
